author: Special Correspondent
text:
Virudhunagar Superintendent of Police P. Aravindhan has appealed to the people to alert the police with regard to violations of model code of conduct during electioneering through ‘Hello Police’ facility.

The facility, launched in November 28, 2015, helps the people air their grievances and lodge complaints with the police through SMS, Whatsapp messages and voice calls at 91500-11000.

With 1,314 complaints having been received through the new facility, Hello Police had become a hit among the people of the district.

In a statement, Mr. Aravindhan said that 104 cases were registered based on complaints received through Hello Police, and 150 persons arrested. Community Service Register receipts were issued for 19 complaints.

Six complaints were registered through SMS, 64 through whatsapp message and 1,244 through voice calls.

Most of the cases were related to public nuisance, illegal sale of liquor, gambling and smuggling of sand. People also used the facility to report on traffic congestions. Many child marriages had been stopped with the tip-off got through the facility.

“Timely alert received over Hello Police also helped the police immediately attend to a group clash in Manoor under Narikudi police limits,” the SP said.

The mobile number of Hello Police facility had been put up at important junctions and crowded places like bus stands for the benefit of the people.
title: “Use ‘Hello Police’ facility to lodge poll-related complaints”
